sen.j: 知行（ちぎょう）とは、日本の中世・近世において、領主が行使した所領支配権を意味する歴史概念。
sen.e: Chigyo is a history-related concept indicating a territory-controlling right executed by territorial lords in the medieval period and early-modern times in Japan.

sen.j: 日本の歴史上の領主はヨーロッパの農奴制における領主のように無制限に所領の土地と人民を私有財産として所有したのではなく、徴税権・支配権にかかわる一定の権利義務の体系を所持した存在であった。
sen.e: Territorial lords in Japanese history were not like those in the serf system in Europe who owned the land and people in his or her territory as his or her private property with no restriction, but possessed a system of certain right and responsibility concerning tax-collecting right and territory-controlling right.
